entries.text:
You are the poem.
The world is merely annotation.

Some poems are not written.
They bleed their way onto the page.

Every poet begins as a listener.
Silence was your first stanza.

You cannot write without dying a little.
You cannot die without writing something new.

The line break is a heartbeat.
The poem breathes where you hesitate.
Ink remembers what the body forgets.
Your handwriting is the graph of your becoming.
Poetry is language remembering its body.
Each poem is a negotiation between chaos and cadence.

You do not find your voice.
You return to it.
A poem is a place where truth and mercy can meet without shame.

Grammar cannot contain grief.
That’s why poetry exists.

The page does not heal you.
It holds you still enough to begin.

Poetry is alchemy.
You turn pain into pattern until it no longer burns.
Write until the ache confesses what it really wanted to say.
Each metaphor is a bridge built over silence.
The poet is both wound and witness.

You do not own the poem.
You channel it.
The best ones arrive uninvited.

When the poem stops rhyming, listen.
It’s trying to tell you the truth.

Some poems are written for survival.
Others for resurrection.

You can revise a poem.
You cannot revise the moment that made it necessary.

Poetry happens in the pause between inhale and exhale.
Where the body remembers the soul’s syntax.

Rhyme is comfort.
Free verse is truth unclothed.

A poet is a scientist of feeling.
We experiment with ache.

Even pain can be made beautiful.
That is the poet’s defiance.
Every poem is an exhale that refused to be ordinary air.

Write what trembles.
Readers will find themselves in the vibration.

Poetry is not therapy.
It is recognition disguised as art.
The poem is a mirror that forgives what it reflects.

When you cannot pray, write.
It’s the same thing in another dialect.

Language does not heal.
But it holds the wound still long enough for light to enter.
Poetry is resistance to numbness.

The poet’s task is not to explain.
It is to remind.
You do not need permission to speak beautifully about pain.

The poem will change you if you let it.
That’s the hidden contract between ink and reader.
Poetry was the first science of empathy.

A good poem is not understood.
It is remembered.
Every stanza is a small rebellion against forgetting.
Poets are translators of the untranslatable.
You are the line break the universe didn’t see coming.
